question.body: The net-like mesh of collagen fibers in the reticular layer add to the resilience of the dermis because of what?

multiple_choice.choice: The collagen fibers form a loose mat that contains blood vessels and phagocytes.
The net-like mesh of collagen fibers stores fat, which holds water.
The net-like mesh of collagen binds and holds water.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The fibroblasts secrete collagen and elastin fibers in the papillary layer, which forms a loose mat.
Incorrect. Fat is stored in the hypodermis layer.
Incorrect. Collagen fibers do not secrete elastin; fibroblasts secrete elastin.
Correct. In addition to providing structure and strength, the collagen fibers hold water to maintain skin turgor.
